title: Twin Spark–Powered Euro 1965 Alfa Romeo Giulia Sprint GT
description: This 1965 Alfa Romeo Giulia Sprint GT is said to have been raced and used for track day events in Europe before being brought to the US in 2018 and subsequently underwent a multi-year build process commissioned by the selling dealer, 1600Veloce, from 2021 through 2024. Work involved a repaint in Giallo Fly and an interior re-trim in dark blue Poltrona Frau leather and gray Alcantara along with installation of a 2.0L Twin Spark inline-four and rebuilt five-speed manual transmission sourced from Alfaholics in the UK. The car rides on 15" GTA-style wheels and features a stepped hood and wrap-around bumpers, while the cockpit is fitted with low-back Recaro seats accompanied by an OMP roll cage, a Hellebore steering wheel, and Veglia instrumentation. The engine is equipped with dual Weber 45 DCOE carburetors paired with Pipercross ram pipes, and further Alfaholics additions include a 3D-mapped ignition setup and stainless-steel exhaust along with their Fast Road Stage 3 suspension package, a big-brake kit with Superleggera calipers, and a race-spec limited-slip differential. This Stepnose is the 1,600th auction from our local partner, 1600veloce, and it is now offered with build records and a Wisconsin title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a Twin Spark–Powered Euro 1965 Alfa Romeo Giulia Sprint GT at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #168,156.
